messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: past lives and monkeys
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/23/01 11:59:10 AM, zenmomma@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/23/01 11:59:10 AM, zenmomma@... writes:

<< She was from Texas originally. Maybe it's another regional thing? >>

My parents were monkey Texans. Might be genetic!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: past lives and monkeys
messages.msgSnippet: ... I d love to, but how? I ve asked Casey, but she no longer remembers any of it. I think dreams are a good avenue to the subconscious and perhap memories of
messages.messageBody:
>>I used to LOVE to read those stories, and I think you should maybe pursue
>>it.<<

I'd love to, but how? I've asked Casey, but she no longer remembers any of
it. I think dreams are a good avenue to the subconscious and perhap memories
of the past. Maybe I should listen even more closely to her dreams. Lately
she's been having recurring dreams that involve a whale/shark that is
threatening her. Hmmmm...

>>If she gets interested in past life regression it would be interesting to
>>see if more of it comes out.<<

Yeah. I'll probably have to wait until she gets older, though. Although with
Casey, you never can tell. ;-)

>>I have a friend who's BIG into that--she's a professional psychic, and she
>>cares SO much I can't keep a straight face. It usually seems bogus and
>>worthless to me, and bad things to remember (we have enough grief and
>>angst from a single life without the burden of others) but then I hear
>>stories like this about Casey and a shiver goes down me and I remember how
>>exciting those stories are.<<

For Jon's last birthday, I gave him a reading with a local intuitive
reader/psychic. He asked if she had any feeling as to why he keeps
changing/losing jobs every 2-3 years like clockwork. It's a definite pattern
in our lives. She told him that in a past life he was a stonemason. He built
castles in medieval times. He had a lot of independence in this line of work
(for the times) so is not used to being tied down to one workplace. When the
castle is done, you move on to a new place. Interesting. It certainly would
help to explain all the rock collections he has around our house.

>>Damn me and my monkey curiosity to hell.<<

Just the other night a friend was commenting that inserting the word monkey
into any statement makes it immediately funny and outrageous at the same
time. She was from Texas originally. Maybe it's another regional thing?

~Mary the monkey goddess
